reviews.text:
Went for brunch. Definitely the place to be if you wanna be welcomed by a tense and aggressive ambiance.
Did not have a chance to taste the menu; customer service did not seem to be a key aspect of the experience for the chef who seems to be the maitre D, the general manager and the waiter at the same time. I am Parisian, lived and traveled the world and know my piece about disagreeable hospitality... but this is a different level.
Side note, at least clean your floor
Iâ€™m still dreaming about the eggs Benedict 3 years later so much so that Iâ€™m writing this review.
This is a nice place. But the manger or guy that works there is very rude. I wonâ€™t be going back.

The service was absolutely exceptional â€” truly beyond five stars! The food was top quality and incredibly delicious. Iâ€™d highly recommend this place to anyone. As a bonus, the ambiance was perfect for a nice date night â€” warm, inviting, and just the right vibe.

Amazing place, very nice and giving staff
Food is extraordinary.
Nice
Service was greater than five stars! Food was high quality and delicious. Definitely highly recommend! As a plus, ambiance was on great for a nice date!
It's fine dining. I went with my husband and his friend. I got the corruption, it was spicy and flavorful. I definitely recommend coming here.
Great food! Great portions for the price

We had a beautiful time at Shlomieâ€™s cafe! The food was delicious, the service was amazing, and we truly just felt like we were at home. What a warm, welcoming, fun cafe! Shlomie is generous and very sweet, complementary babka and tea was incredible. ×ª×‘×•×¨×š ××›×œ ×”×œ×‘

Incredible from start to finish. The owner and his son were so kind and welcoming. It felt like home. The sandwiches, desserts, and drinks were delicious. We ordered the gingy and the corruption. Creative names and execution. The chocolate babka melts in your mouth. My goodness the blintz was so yummy. We didnâ€™t get any pictures because we ate everything so quickly. Plus they had chess for anyone to play. Canâ€™t wait to come back
Great food talented manager

Itâ€™s a stylish, dairy kosher cafÃ© located away on a quiet street in Crown Heights neighborhood in Brooklyn. The space is exceptionally clean, with a thoughtfully designed interior that reflects the personal touch of its owner. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted warmly by the owner himselfâ€”a friendly, multilingual individual who makes you feel more like a cherished guest than just another customer.
A black-and-white photograph of his parents hangs on the wall, and classic Israeli music plays softly in the background, adding to the inviting and nostalgic atmosphere. The food is fresh and flavorful, made with high-quality ingredients that you can truly taste. I also appreciated the way everything was beautifully presented.

Wednesday morning felt like a teenager: windy and just nineteen. The frosty draft was the king in Kings County. Imagining the long day ahead, I decided to start with something warm and healthy. Or at least tasty. Okay, just tasty. After all, it was my birthday â€” I owed myself a treat!

I headed to Bouâ€™ote, one of the most stylish cafÃ©s in Central Brooklyn which sticks out like a Monet painting dropped in the middle of Springfield, TN.

The cafÃ© is run by Shlomo, a tough-looking Israeli guy, likely with a military past, who somehow manages to blend grit and charm in equal measure. Okay, almost equal.

As I sat sipping my coffee, a mailwoman walked in. She was young, sporting a Jamaican accent, and looked like sheâ€™d been frozen solid on her route. Yet when offered a cup of coffee, she refused with a smile.

â€œYou made me a coffee yesterday and the day before that. Youâ€™re going to spoil me!â€ she laughed.

Shlomo leaned over the counter, unfazed. â€œFine,â€ he said, â€œIâ€™ll make you one tomorrow. But today, I need a favor.â€

I held my breath, expecting the worst. Asking her to run an errand in this weather? Surely not!

â€œAre you heading down Troy Avenue?â€ he asked.

â€œYes,â€ she replied.

â€œPerfect. Could you take this cappuccino to the school crossing guard? Sheâ€™s standing out there in the cold all morning â€” it must be brutal.â€

And just like that, my day was made! What I thought would be an awkward feeling turned into the perfect birthday gift: the gift of witnessing kindness, compassion, and care in action.

Shlomoâ€™s gesture was contagious. His cup of coffee warmed two pairs of hands â€” and who knows how many hearts, mine included. Warmed and inspired.
Eggs Benedict ğŸ¤¤

Lovely spot, authentic, and original.
The Kreplach are an explosion of delicious flavors. The Maryuma (Shakshuka in Matboucha) is delicious as well.
The food was amazing and the service was even better. Shlomi was extremely warm and friendly and truly made it a special breakfast experience for me and my dad.
Everything was tremendous.
owner was really rude with his employees.
Great experience but you go there to see for yourself and enjoy.
A cute, small cafe with a very nice atmosphere and great food!
Super nice staff. Very patient with kids

Creative menu, executed very well
Cozy, friendly

We had an amazing time at Bou'ote. The owner as usual, was super friendly and came out to talk to us about each dish he had and any questions we asked. You can tell he really really enjoys what he does and it's more than just his passion, because at first I ordered a sea-bass sandwich, and after a couple minutes he came out saying that the bread wasn't up to his standards and he doesn't feel comfortable sending it out. Which was something I really appreciated!

We ordered the Savory Babka, and it was DELICIOUS! ORDER IT! we ordered the Maryuma which is a style of shakshuka but made differently. (matbucha style). My wife ordered eggs Benedict, and lemonade that came with a delicious cream on top.

He also sent out some borscht that he was experimenting with, and some other complimentary things.

We had a great time, and a great experience. We will definitely be back!
Absolutely fantastic

Super cool decor, feels like youâ€™re transported back to Europe a hundred years ago. The food is really unique and hand crafted. The people who work there really love what they do. Would definitely come back!
Food, atmosphere, service - all great! A gem in the neighborhood.
I came a bit early and was first in. Great place! Even better food. The owner is also always here and really friendly.

I go so often, I get to sample all the incredible goodies.
Must try the Savory Babka! You cannot get it anywhere. Same goes for the Maryuma and the Scrambled eggs. :)

I come here a lot
I just waited 30 min and wasnâ€™t offered water the shop is understaffed extremely and can only handle about 3 people at a time the food is delicious but they donâ€™t cater to your allergies so if a slice of a fish is no good that dish is no longer a viable option as they wonâ€™t remove anything
The staff is very friendly but extremely in American and not friendly
It as if he does you a favour bu letting you come here
Good food, friendly people.
I've never been so happy to give someone five star review
Food was delicious

This is one of those exceptional spots where the owner is manically obsessed with serving food that feeds you on a deep level both culinarily and spiritually.
Shlomie the owner is meticulous in making sure your dish is perfect and will singularly focus on each person, table and dish, one at a time.
Go with patience and grace and youâ€™ll often be rewarded with an extra slice of incredible babka chefs compliments  because shloime felt like you just had to have it.
We ordered the Gingy - felt like biting into a slice of a Seattle fish market with the freshest array of orange fish, down to the caviar sprinkled about.
Special of the day Potato Knish - lathered with a poached egg and mustard sauce.  Felt like being transported to the lower east side 100 years ago.
For the grand finale the cheese blitzes transport you to a Parisian cafe which is what this place feels like the second you walk in.

Disappointing Experience at Bou'ote

I recently visited Bou'ote and was looking forward to a nice meal. Unfortunately, the service was appalling, and the owner's behavior was completely unacceptable.

I asked for some sauce on the side and he refused to give me any whatsoever he said this is how it comes and won't let me add anything on the side.

But the real shock came when the owner joined our table. Instead of apologizing or trying to make things right, he became defensive and argumentative. When we expressed our disappointment, he responded with sarcasm and disrespect. It was clear that he didn't value our business or care about our experience.

The food was mediocre at best, but the terrible service and owner's attitude made this one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. I would not recommend Bou'ote to anyone and will not be returning.

Good fresh food .
Excellent chef.personal service
Thank you for wonderful presentation and experience, and delicious breakfast
Great Israeli food with unique twists. My favorite is the corruption sandwich if you like something spicy and the kreplach if you want something more savory

The food is great and the place is nice ( a little tight,  but nice )
The only problem is the owner/ chef
He is extremely rude and I always feel discomfort being there because of him , I would be scared to ask him for suger or coffee cause he would yell at me that he's " busy " or whatever .
It's a real shame as the food is amazing

The warm embrace of the owner of this charming cafe reminded me of the very best of the Israeli family feeling of decades ago. It was like walking into a time machine of feelings and tastes, while at the same time experiencing the depth of flavors developed over the past few decades. Everything was better than the memories and I walked out feeling nourished nutrionally, culturally, and more importantly by a sense of connection to our great Jewish family.
Such a beautiful spot!! Tried a bunch of things, and everything was SO SO delicious!!!!!!! Highly recommend!!! Will definitely come back for more!!
Great place, vibe, service, and to top it off the food if phenomenal!!

The food is actually good. The atmosphere beautiful but incredibly tight. The owner is annoying and annoyed. Heâ€™s a tough guy to work with and the energy in there is too intense. I was nervous to ask for salt or sugar for my coffee. I will go back again to take out tho as the food was solid.
Thank you for the great food, great service and being part of our community. Highly recommended!
Love that place
One of the best restaurants I've visited, a taste of homeğŸ«¶ğŸ»
Great food! Friendly atmosphere and best coffee in the area

Great architecture and design

Great service; they treated us really nice

We felt like we dining at a throwback time machine olden day museum.

Dishes were yum
Drink were amazing
Desert was awesome

Best customer service in crown heights

Very nice clean place, friendly staff. Real good d coffee, though over expensive as to go in this area. But generally very nice espresso , so for sure recommended. Anyway itâ€™s no espresso especially kosher around. So you have no choice but this choice is good . Classic European design.

The food was at its upmost quality and everything I tasted was amazing. But for some odd reason, if you don't like an ingredient (or just simply allergic) in a specific menu item, they wont do it. He said "It comes as it comes". Like Iâ€¦
Very unique food style and fun experience. Definitely coming back to try the other stuff.

They are very focused on their method.
Come here if you are ready to try out of the box foods. After all its a moroccan that loves ashkenazi food, go figure!
They want to keep to their standard always, so no changes to their food whatsoever.
Staff is usually friendly, bill is usually somewhat expensive. But its good and flavorful.
Recommend - krepalach, apple strudel(THE BEST), eggs benedict, grilled cheese, blinzes, bakba ( on the cake side), the classic lox.
If you are NOT ready to try new things keep the different but still comforting food :)

The food is delicious and the service attentive. I came with my mom for coffee and dinner. Itâ€™s more of a breakfast / lunch / or evening snack type of place but we really wanted to try it out and we were glad we did. We tried the latkes,â€¦

Very fresh and authentically-made smoked fish and breads: eggs Benedict with a unique & creamy hollandaise, homemade latkas, shakshuka with tomato-pepper reduction and fresh challah, real tuna fish salad, lox dishes, knish and blintzes. Coffee beans are flavorful and rich. Small storefront near subway on Troy and Eastern, plenty of street parking.

Everything was great! I was there with my boyfriend and the staff it's just the best, amazing food and coffe!
A place that you have to go!!!
Totally recommend
Great place in crown heights Brooklyn. You feel like youâ€™re eating momâ€™s food. Owner and staff are so nice and charming.
Beautiful environment, kind staff, tasty food and coffee. On the expensive side considering the smaller portion size, but itâ€™s a fancier place for Crown Heights kosher options.

The food is creative and delicious, the staff are friendly and very helpful, the seating is comfortable and interesting. I love the space and overall feel. My only dislike is the automatic 18% gratuity on any size groups who sit down. Theâ€¦

This place is mainly a fish and champagne (bubbles) establishment.
During the day this place is a cafe, Wednesday and Thursday nights it turns into a classy champagne bar. The food is unique and delicious. The eggs benedict was made perfectly, totally recommend it. The corruption sandwich is spicy, but so good. The grill cheese is one of a kind. On top of it all their drinks are made well. The place is small with not so many seats, but the wait service is top notch. There is something fishy when it comes to the bill... They choose 15% tip with out asking? No mention of this anywhere. Also they don't give or offer a receipt?
Not an everyday place, but nice for special occasions.

New, beautiful place! Amazing service, small menu which everything is delicious. The atmosphere in this cafe is so different then typical kosher places. A coffee shop with a liquor license and yummy home made food? Too good to be true, butâ€¦

Food was great. Ambience was like a classic American diner, complete with 1950s-60s era R&B and blues playing over the speakers. The place is small, but the service was personal and friendly. The owner chatted us up a bit and was willing to go out of his way to make sure our adolescent daughter was happy with her meal. Would certainly return.

Food at this place is extraordinary. Very friendly staff quick order to table turnaround time,had a wonderful experience.  Additionally in the bathroom there's is wipes in addition to toilet paper and I've been around NY to many restaurantsâ€¦

Amazing service, I loved the decor and the food was absolutely delicious. We sat for a little more than three hours at Buo'ote and ordered the Kreplach and Babka along with a hot chocolate and cappuccino. The owner, in what I must assumeâ€¦

A couple of notable points.

1. The food is actually pretty good. Very interesting menu with multiple cool options. You wonâ€™t find food like this at other places in Crown Heights.

2. The store is physically nice; a bit of a tight space, but the decor is very cute.

3. Most importantly. The manager, who seems to also be the chef, the barista, and the cashier, is an incredibly difficult person to communicate with. Perhaps itâ€™s the result of a different upbringing, a different culture, or just an overall unhealthy set of characteristics, but the manager is somehow a mix of incredibly rude and arrogant and yet also slightly kind and sweet. He makes unnecessarily rude comments, jokes about sensitive topics, and I would bet would generally make most customers feel uncomfortable. He acts this way with everyone; presenting as a caretaker who is â€œbrutally honestâ€ and â€œnot interested in sensitivityâ€ and truly comes off as one of the most off-putting human beings youâ€™ll ever meet. At the same time, heâ€™ll always offer a free dessert at the end of your meal and seems to pay close attention to the food to make sure itâ€™s as precise as he likes it. Exactly that: as â€œheâ€ likes it. This store seems to be his pride and joy, but as a customer, you feel like youâ€™ve invaded his arena and will find yourself constantly walking on eggshells just to avoid having a conversation with him. If you say you like one dish, heâ€™ll say â€œwell why donâ€™t you tell me what you really think about the other dish? you hated it! you can say that, iâ€™m not sensitive!â€ and will leave you left speechless with no way to properly respond. I would put down money that for every day he works at this restaurant, they lose money. Thereâ€™s no way most customers are willing to deal with him the first time they visit; let alone even thinking to come back a second time. In my opinion, this store would be 1000% better off if they just had someone else deal with customers. This guy is certainly not built for the job. The fact that heâ€™s been working there since they opened and theyâ€™re somehow STILL open is purely a miracle to me.

4. Something to bear in mind is that the menu has zero descriptions below any of the food choices. I assume itâ€™s to give it an â€œupper-class, high-tax bracketâ€ feel but really just leads to an impossibly confusing experience where youâ€™re forced to ask the manager (bear in mind the descriptions of him above) to explain basically everything on the menu to you, making you feel stupid and like youâ€™re wasting everybodyâ€™s time. They treat you as if you â€œshouldâ€ know the whole menu like you made it yourself. Very odd. (Just discovered a neat little trick; you can find the menu with actual descriptions on the internet due to this place being on DoorDash. Hope that helps.)

5. The coffee is meh. The cups are cool and the metal straws are a nice touch but overall, the drinks here are just â€œokayâ€.

6. If youâ€™ve stumbled across this review, youâ€™ve probably also realized just how difficult it is to FIND this place on Google Maps. The spelling and pronunciation of â€œBouâ€™oteâ€ is profoundly confusing and leads to a definitively rough time looking for this place on the internet. Not the best branding tactic.

7. Nothing about the design/branding/marketing of this place screams â€œour sandwich menu is nearly entirely fish optionsâ€ but itâ€™s certainly true. If you donâ€™t like smoked fish, good luck navigating your way around this menu.

At the end of the day, I decided to rate this place 2 stars. If the customer experience was better, and by that I mean if they hired literally ANYONE but the guy who currently manages this place, I would probably have rated it 3 and a half stars, maybe even 4. Regardless, I wish him well in all his endeavors, and hope that with enough time and feedback, heâ€™ll see how much worse of an experience he offers the people around him and will choose to make the necessary changes in action and attitude to improve himself, his relationships, and probably turn this establishment into a beautiful little sanctuary right on the outskirts on Crown Heights. :)

Wonderful and interesting cafe with a great fun vibe. The owner/manager was super helpful, kind, and friendly. Incredible food! Beautiful atmosphere! Great service! Very impressed! 10/10 would absolutely recommend!

My wife usually orders a few different menu items so she can taste everything.  This is the first time she actually ate all of the food she ordered, which was a lot (and some of my food too). Everything was delectable and service was five stars. It was a truly wonderful dining experience and we can't wait to go back.

The staff were very very nice, friendly, eager to please. The food was immensely tasty and full of flavor. The menu is a bit limited but they said that that will change in the near future. There isn't a lot of seating but that's to beâ€¦
Special experience, a unique corner, great vibes and amazing food. Shlomo the bartender was so entertaining and good energy, and we got some dessert on the house, definitely will see you again soon!

Restaurant is a breath of fresh air in crown heights. Feels like a little oasis, fabulous decor that makes you feel like youâ€™re in an old Hollywood movie, delicious food, and friendly kind servers! Hope theyâ€™re around for many more years to come!

We had a family celebration here and the owner and wait staff were attentive to every detail and accommodating. Food was excellent. Decor is like a bistro in Paris. Service could not have been better.

Tuna sandwich was a good size, freshly made and very delicious.
David has great customer service from the second you enter the restaurant.
Really looking forward to the new menu items.

The details of this place are so beautiful -cloth napkins, french wicker chairs and b&w checkered floors. You can tell this place was designed with intention. Best babka Iâ€™ve ever had. Highly recommend.
